segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Management System Release Notes

segment.source: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.
segment.target: To search these Release Notes, press CTRL+F.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Application Virtualization Management System.
segment.target: Read these Release Notes thoroughly before you install the Application Virtualization Management System.

segment.source: These Release Notes contain information that you need to successfully install the Application Virtualization Management System.
segment.target: These Release Notes contain information that you need to successfully install the Application Virtualization Management System.

segment.source: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.
segment.target: This document contains information that is not available in the product documentation.

segment.source: If there is a discrepancy between these Release Notes and other Application Virtualization Management System documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.
segment.target: If there is a discrepancy between these Release Notes and other Application Virtualization Management System documentation, the latest change should be considered authoritative.

segment.source: These Release Notes supersede the content included with this product.
segment.target: These Release Notes supersede the content included with this product.

segment.source: For updated information about known issues, please visit the Microsoft TechNet Library at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122918.
segment.target: For updated information about known issues, please visit the Microsoft TechNet Library at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122918.

segment.source: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1
segment.target: About Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1

segment.source: These Release Notes have been updated to reflect the changes introduced with Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1 (App-V 4.5 CU1), which provides the latest updates to Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5.
segment.target: These Release Notes have been updated to reflect the changes introduced with Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1 (App-V 4.5 CU1), which provides the latest updates to Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5.

segment.source: This cumulative update contains the following changes:
segment.target: This cumulative update contains the following changes:

segment.source: Support for Windows 7 Beta and Windows Server 2008 R2 Beta: App-V 4.5 CU1 addresses compatibility issues with Windows 7 Beta and Windows Server 2008 R2 Beta.
segment.target: Support for Windows 7 Beta and Windows Server 2008 R2 Beta: App-V 4.5 CU1 addresses compatibility issues with Windows 7 Beta and Windows Server 2008 R2 Beta.

segment.source: Support will be provided for blocking issues that prevent App-V 4.5 CU1 running in a test environment on pre-RTM versions of Windows 7.
segment.target: Support will be provided for blocking issues that prevent App-V 4.5 CU1 running in a test environment on pre-RTM versions of Windows 7.

segment.source: This will help ensure that your virtual applications can run successfully in a test environment where compatibility between App-V 4.5 Client and Windows 7 Beta is required.
segment.target: This will help ensure that your virtual applications can run successfully in a test environment where compatibility between App-V 4.5 Client and Windows 7 Beta is required.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: Running App-V 4.5 CU1 on any version of Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 in a live operating environment is not supported.
segment.target: Running App-V 4.5 CU1 on any version of Windows 7 or Windows Server 2008 R2 in a live operating environment is not supported.

segment.source: Improved support for sequencing the .NET Framework: App-V 4.5 CU1 addresses previous issues with sequencing the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier on Windows XP (SP2 or later).
segment.target: Improved support for sequencing the .NET Framework: App-V 4.5 CU1 addresses previous issues with sequencing the .NET Framework 3.5 and earlier on Windows XP (SP2 or later).

segment.source: For more information about the new capabilities, see the TechNet article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=123412.
segment.target: For more information about the new capabilities, see the TechNet article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=123412.

segment.source: Customer Feedback and Hotfix Rollup: App-V 4.5 CU1 also includes a rollup up of fixes to address issues found since the App-V 4.5 RTM release.
segment.target: Customer Feedback and Hotfix Rollup: App-V 4.5 CU1 also includes a rollup up of fixes to address issues found since the App-V 4.5 RTM release.

segment.source: This includes a combination of known issues and customer feedback from our internal teams, partners, and customers who are using App-V 4.5.
segment.target: This includes a combination of known issues and customer feedback from our internal teams, partners, and customers who are using App-V 4.5.

segment.source: For a full list of the included updates, see the KB article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=141258.
segment.target: For a full list of the included updates, see the KB article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=141258.

segment.source: About the Product Documentation
segment.target: About the Product Documentation

segment.source: Comprehensive documentation for Application Virtualization (App-V) is available on Microsoft TechNet in the Application Virtualization (App-V) TechCenter at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122939.
segment.target: Comprehensive documentation for Application Virtualization (App-V) is available on Microsoft TechNet in the Application Virtualization (App-V) TechCenter at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122939.

segment.source: The TechNet documentation includes the online Help for the Application Virtualization Sequencer, the Application Virtualization Client, and the Application Virtualization Server.
segment.target: The TechNet documentation includes the online Help for the Application Virtualization Sequencer, the Application Virtualization Client, and the Application Virtualization Server.

segment.source: It also includes the Application Virtualization Planning and Deployment Guide and the Application Virtualization Operations Guide.
segment.target: It also includes the Application Virtualization Planning and Deployment Guide and the Application Virtualization Operations Guide.

segment.source: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses
segment.target: Protect Against Security Vulnerabilities and Viruses

segment.source: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, it is important to install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.
segment.target: To help protect against security vulnerabilities and viruses, it is important to install the latest available security updates for any new software being installed.

segment.source: For more information, see the Microsoft Security Web site at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482.
segment.target: For more information, see the Microsoft Security Web site at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=3482.

segment.source: Providing Feedback
segment.target: Providing Feedback

segment.source: You can provide feedback, make a suggestion, or report an issue with the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System via a community forum on the Microsoft Application Virtualization TechCenter (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122917).
segment.target: You can provide feedback, make a suggestion, or report an issue with the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) Management System via a community forum on the Microsoft Application Virtualization TechCenter (http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=122917).

segment.source: You can also provide your feedback on the documentation directly to the App-V documentation team.
segment.target: You can also provide your feedback on the documentation directly to the App-V documentation team.

segment.source: Send your documentation feedback to appvdocs@microsoft.com.
segment.target: Send your documentation feedback to appvdocs@microsoft.com.

segment.source: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.5 CU1
segment.target: Known Issues with Application Virtualization 4.5 CU1

segment.source: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 CU1.
segment.target: This section provides the most up-to-date information about issues with Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 4.5 CU1.

segment.source: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.
segment.target: These issues do not appear in the product documentation and in some cases might contradict existing product documentation.

segment.source: Whenever possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.
segment.target: Whenever possible, these issues will be addressed in later releases.

segment.source: Guidance for installing or upgrading clients to App-V 4.5 CU1 using setup.msi
segment.target: Guidance for installing or upgrading clients to App-V 4.5 CU1 using setup.msi

segment.source: When installing or upgrading your App-V clients to App-V 4.5 CU1 by using setup.msi, the prerequisites are not installed automatically.
segment.target: When installing or upgrading your App-V clients to App-V 4.5 CU1 by using setup.msi, the prerequisites are not installed automatically.

segment.source: WORKAROUND You must manually install the prerequisites before installing or upgrading the App-V client to 4.5 CU1.
segment.target: WORKAROUND You must manually install the prerequisites before installing or upgrading the App-V client to 4.5 CU1.

segment.source: For detailed procedures for installing the prerequisites and the App-V client, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144106.
segment.target: For detailed procedures for installing the prerequisites and the App-V client, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144106.

segment.source: When this has been completed, install the App-V 4.5 CU1 client by using setup.msi with elevated privileges.
segment.target: When this has been completed, install the App-V 4.5 CU1 client by using setup.msi with elevated privileges.

segment.source: This file is available on the App-V 4.5 CU1 release media in the InstallersClient folder.
segment.target: This file is available on the App-V 4.5 CU1 release media in the InstallersClient folder.

segment.source: When installing Microsoft Application Error Reporting, use the following command if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 CU1 Desktop client:
segment.target: When installing Microsoft Application Error Reporting, use the following command if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 CU1 Desktop client:

segment.source: Alternatively, if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 CU1 Terminal Services client, use the following command:
segment.target: Alternatively, if you are installing or upgrading to the App-V 4.5 CU1 Terminal Services client, use the following command:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The APPGUID parameter references the product code of the App-V client that you install or upgrade to.
segment.target: The APPGUID parameter references the product code of the App-V client that you install or upgrade to.

segment.source: The product code is unique for each setup.msi.
segment.target: The product code is unique for each setup.msi.

segment.source: You can use the Orca database editor or similar tool to examine Windows Installer files and determine the product code.
segment.target: You can use the Orca database editor or similar tool to examine Windows Installer files and determine the product code.

segment.source: This step is required for all installs or upgrades to App-V 4.5 CU1.
segment.target: This step is required for all installs or upgrades to App-V 4.5 CU1.

segment.source: Some applications might fail to install during the monitoring phase when sequencing on Windows 7 Beta
segment.target: Some applications might fail to install during the monitoring phase when sequencing on Windows 7 Beta

segment.source: When sequencing on Windows 7 Beta or on a computer with Windows Installer 5.0, some applications might fail to install during the monitoring phase.
segment.target: When sequencing on Windows 7 Beta or on a computer with Windows Installer 5.0, some applications might fail to install during the monitoring phase.

segment.source: WORKAROUND You must manually grant the Everyone group Full Control permissions to the following registry key:
segment.target: WORKAROUND You must manually grant the Everyone group Full Control permissions to the following registry key:

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: You must use the Advanced button to set the “Include inheritable permissions from this object’s parent” option.
segment.target: You must use the Advanced button to set the “Include inheritable permissions from this object’s parent” option.

segment.source: Unable to save packages when sequencing on Windows 7 Beta
segment.target: Unable to save packages when sequencing on Windows 7 Beta

segment.source: When sequencing on Windows 7 Beta, you might be unable to save your sequenced package because of a sharing violation.
segment.target: When sequencing on Windows 7 Beta, you might be unable to save your sequenced package because of a sharing violation.

segment.source: WORKAROUND As specified in the best practices section of the Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Sequencing Guide (see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144108), you must shutdown and disable the following software programs before you begin sequencing:
segment.target: WORKAROUND As specified in the best practices section of the Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Sequencing Guide (see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=144108), you must shutdown and disable the following software programs before you begin sequencing:

segment.source: Windows Defender
segment.target: Windows Defender

segment.source: Antivirus software
segment.target: Antivirus software

segment.source: Disk defragmentation software
segment.target: Disk defragmentation software

segment.source: Windows Search
segment.target: Windows Search

segment.source: Any open Windows Explorer session
segment.target: Any open Windows Explorer session

segment.source: In addition, if you have Microsoft Update running on the sequencing station to capture updates during the package update process, you will need to add “C:WindowsSoftwareDistribution” as a VFS exclusion before you start sequencing.
segment.target: In addition, if you have Microsoft Update running on the sequencing station to capture updates during the package update process, you will need to add “C:WindowsSoftwareDistribution” as a VFS exclusion before you start sequencing.

segment.source: Improving performance when sequencing the .NET Framework
segment.target: Improving performance when sequencing the .NET Framework

segment.source: When sequencing the .NET Framework, you might experience reduced system performance because the Microsoft .NET Framework NGEN service attempts to precompile assemblies as a background task.
segment.target: When sequencing the .NET Framework, you might experience reduced system performance because the Microsoft .NET Framework NGEN service attempts to precompile assemblies as a background task.

segment.source: WORKAROUND When sequencing the .NET Framework, disable the Microsoft .NET Framework NGEN service (mscorsvw.exe) after completing the monitoring phase.
segment.target: WORKAROUND When sequencing the .NET Framework, disable the Microsoft .NET Framework NGEN service (mscorsvw.exe) after completing the monitoring phase.

segment.source: You must use the Virtual Services tab in the Sequencer and change the startup type to disabled.
segment.target: You must use the Virtual Services tab in the Sequencer and change the startup type to disabled.

segment.source: Interoperability issues with the Windows 7 Taskbar
segment.target: Interoperability issues with the Windows 7 Taskbar

segment.source: When you run the Application Virtualization Client on Windows 7, the Windows 7 taskbar does not collapse multiple instances of a virtual application into a single taskbar button.
segment.target: When you run the Application Virtualization Client on Windows 7, the Windows 7 taskbar does not collapse multiple instances of a virtual application into a single taskbar button.

segment.source: In addition, jump Lists do not appear when you right-click a taskbar button of a virtual application, unless the application has been pinned to the Windows 7 taskbar.
segment.target: In addition, jump Lists do not appear when you right-click a taskbar button of a virtual application, unless the application has been pinned to the Windows 7 taskbar.

segment.source: When you uninstall the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client, user settings associated with the user performing the uninstall will be deleted
segment.target: When you uninstall the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client, user settings associated with the user performing the uninstall will be deleted

segment.source: When you uninstall the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client, the Windows Installer will remove Application Virtualization settings from the current user's profile.
segment.target: When you uninstall the Microsoft Application Virtualization Client, the Windows Installer will remove Application Virtualization settings from the current user's profile.

segment.source: If your computer uses roaming profiles, do not use your personal network account to uninstall the client because it will remove settings for your virtual applications on all of your computers.
segment.target: If your computer uses roaming profiles, do not use your personal network account to uninstall the client because it will remove settings for your virtual applications on all of your computers.

segment.source: WORKAROUND You should perform the App-V Client uninstall with an administrative account that is not used for running virtual applications.
segment.target: WORKAROUND You should perform the App-V Client uninstall with an administrative account that is not used for running virtual applications.

segment.source: Edits made on the virtual file system and virtual registry tabs must be saved while running the Sequencing wizard
segment.target: Edits made on the virtual file system and virtual registry tabs must be saved while running the Sequencing wizard

segment.source: If you open a package to perform an upgrade or have already run the Sequencing wizard with a new package and you make changes to the package in the virtual file system or virtual registry tabs, those changes are not automatically saved.
segment.target: If you open a package to perform an upgrade or have already run the Sequencing wizard with a new package and you make changes to the package in the virtual file system or virtual registry tabs, those changes are not automatically saved.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Save the changes before re-running the wizard, to ensure that they are reflected inside the wizard’s virtual environment.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Save the changes before re-running the wizard, to ensure that they are reflected inside the wizard’s virtual environment.

segment.source: Command-line Sequencer must be run from an elevated command prompt
segment.target: Command-line Sequencer must be run from an elevated command prompt

segment.source: When you use the command-line Sequencer, it does not prompt for elevation.
segment.target: When you use the command-line Sequencer, it does not prompt for elevation.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Run the command-line Sequencer using an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Run the command-line Sequencer using an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: Server Management Console configuration in distributed environments
segment.target: Server Management Console configuration in distributed environments

segment.source: If you need to install management components onto systems other than the primary Application Virtualization publishing and streaming server, the server install supports installing our management console and Web service on separate servers from the primary Application Virtualization Server when properly configured.
segment.target: If you need to install management components onto systems other than the primary Application Virtualization publishing and streaming server, the server install supports installing our management console and Web service on separate servers from the primary Application Virtualization Server when properly configured.

segment.source: To distribute the management components across multiple servers, Kerberos delegation must be enabled on the server where the Web service is installed.
segment.target: To distribute the management components across multiple servers, Kerberos delegation must be enabled on the server where the Web service is installed.

segment.source: Short path variable names in OSD files can cause errors
segment.target: Short path variable names in OSD files can cause errors

segment.source: If you receive error 450478-1F702339-0000010B “The directory name is invalid” when starting a virtual application on the client, it is possible that the variable in the OSD is set incorrectly.
segment.target: If you receive error 450478-1F702339-0000010B “The directory name is invalid” when starting a virtual application on the client, it is possible that the variable in the OSD is set incorrectly.

segment.source: This can happen if the application’s installer sets a short path name during sequencing.
segment.target: This can happen if the application’s installer sets a short path name during sequencing.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Remove the trailing tilde from any CSIDL variable that exists in the OSD file.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Remove the trailing tilde from any CSIDL variable that exists in the OSD file.

segment.source: Correct syntax for DECODEPATH parameter for command-line Sequencer
segment.target: Correct syntax for DECODEPATH parameter for command-line Sequencer

segment.source: In the command-line Sequencer, when opening a package for upgrade and decoding it to the root of the Q drive, the syntax for the DECODEPATH parameter should not include a trailing slash.
segment.target: In the command-line Sequencer, when opening a package for upgrade and decoding it to the root of the Q drive, the syntax for the DECODEPATH parameter should not include a trailing slash.

segment.source: WORKAROUND You can use Q: rather than Q: (omitting the trailing “” character).
segment.target: WORKAROUND You can use Q: rather than Q: (omitting the trailing “” character).

segment.source: When upgrading 4.2 packages, you encounter problems caused by Windows Installer files in the Virtual File System
segment.target: When upgrading 4.2 packages, you encounter problems caused by Windows Installer files in the Virtual File System

segment.source: When upgrading a package from 4.2, you might experience issues relating to a mismatch of Windows Installer system files that were included by default in 4.2 and the Windows Installer libraries locally installed on your Sequencing workstation.
segment.target: When upgrading a package from 4.2, you might experience issues relating to a mismatch of Windows Installer system files that were included by default in 4.2 and the Windows Installer libraries locally installed on your Sequencing workstation.

segment.source: The following files are located in CSIDLSYSTEM:
segment.target: The following files are located in CSIDLSYSTEM:

segment.source: cabinet.dll
segment.target: cabinet.dll

segment.source: msi.dll
segment.target: msi.dll

segment.source: msiexec.exe
segment.target: msiexec.exe

segment.source: msihnd.dll
segment.target: msihnd.dll

segment.source: msimsg.dlll
segment.target: msimsg.dlll

segment.source: WORKAROUND Delete all of the preceding files from the package.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Delete all of the preceding files from the package.

segment.source: Delete the mappings on the VFS tab as well as the actual files in the CSIDLSYSTEM folder in your decode path.
segment.target: Delete the mappings on the VFS tab as well as the actual files in the CSIDLSYSTEM folder in your decode path.

segment.source: On Windows XP, client install logging is not enabled by default
segment.target: On Windows XP, client install logging is not enabled by default

segment.source: When installing the client, to ensure that any install errors are captured for troubleshooting purposes, you should enable logging by using the command line.
segment.target: When installing the client, to ensure that any install errors are captured for troubleshooting purposes, you should enable logging by using the command line.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Add the parameter /lvx! log.txt to the command line, as shown in the following example:
segment.target: WORKAROUND Add the parameter /lvx! log.txt to the command line, as shown in the following example:

segment.source: setup.exe /s /v”/qn /lvx!
segment.target: setup.exe /s /v”/qn /lvx!

segment.source: log.txt”
segment.target: log.txt”

segment.source: msiexec.exe /i setup.msi /qn /lvx!
segment.target: msiexec.exe /i setup.msi /qn /lvx!

segment.source: log.txt
segment.target: log.txt

segment.source: Alternatively, you can set the registry key to the following value:
segment.target: Alternatively, you can set the registry key to the following value:

segment.source: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREPoliciesMicrosoftWindowsInstaller "Logging"="voicewarmupx!"
segment.target: HKEYLOCALMACHINESOFTWAREPoliciesMicrosoftWindowsInstaller "Logging"="voicewarmupx!"

segment.source: For Kerberos authentication to work, Service Principal Names (SPNs) must be registered for IIS
segment.target: For Kerberos authentication to work, Service Principal Names (SPNs) must be registered for IIS

segment.source: When using IIS 6.0 or 7.0 for icon or OSD file retrieval and streaming of packages, for Kerberos authentication to be enabled, the SPNs must be registered as follows:
segment.target: When using IIS 6.0 or 7.0 for icon or OSD file retrieval and streaming of packages, for Kerberos authentication to be enabled, the SPNs must be registered as follows:

segment.source: On the IIS server, run the following commands by using the SETSPN.EXE Resource Kit tool.
segment.target: On the IIS server, run the following commands by using the SETSPN.EXE Resource Kit tool.

segment.source: The server fully qualified domain name (FQDN) must be used.
segment.target: The server fully qualified domain name (FQDN) must be used.

segment.source: Setspn -r SOFTGRID/Server FQDN
segment.target: Setspn -r SOFTGRID/Server FQDN

segment.source: Setspn -r HTTP/Server FQDN
segment.target: Setspn -r HTTP/Server FQDN

segment.source: For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=131407.
segment.target: For more information, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=131407.

segment.source: On upgrade from RC, the default permissions on client logs do not allow for non-admin users to access the logs for troubleshooting and support
segment.target: On upgrade from RC, the default permissions on client logs do not allow for non-admin users to access the logs for troubleshooting and support

segment.source: The default permissions on client logs for the Application Virtualization RC client did not allow for non-admin access to log files, and manual changes to these log permissions were reverted when clients were restarted.
segment.target: The default permissions on client logs for the Application Virtualization RC client did not allow for non-admin access to log files, and manual changes to these log permissions were reverted when clients were restarted.

segment.source: This has been corrected in the RTM release for new client installs, but on upgrade from RC, the custom permissions on existing log files are not reset.
segment.target: This has been corrected in the RTM release for new client installs, but on upgrade from RC, the custom permissions on existing log files are not reset.

segment.source: However, when any new logs are created or after a log reset, the files will have the new default permissions.
segment.target: However, when any new logs are created or after a log reset, the files will have the new default permissions.

segment.source: WORKAROUND After the upgrade, reset existing client logs or manually change their permissions.
segment.target: WORKAROUND After the upgrade, reset existing client logs or manually change their permissions.

segment.source: .NET compatibility changes
segment.target: .NET compatibility changes

segment.source: Microsoft Application Virtualization Cumulative Update 1 supports sequencing the .NET Framework on Windows XP (SP2 or later).
segment.target: Microsoft Application Virtualization Cumulative Update 1 supports sequencing the .NET Framework on Windows XP (SP2 or later).

segment.source: Sequencing routines for .NET applications that were written for SoftGrid 4.2 might need to be updated when used with the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.
segment.target: Sequencing routines for .NET applications that were written for SoftGrid 4.2 might need to be updated when used with the App-V 4.5 Sequencer.

segment.source: For details and workarounds, please refer to the Knowledge Base article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=123412.
segment.target: For details and workarounds, please refer to the Knowledge Base article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=123412.

segment.source: After client upgrade from App-V 4.2, some applications are not shown
segment.target: After client upgrade from App-V 4.2, some applications are not shown

segment.source: Check for the following error in the log: ”The Application Virtualization Client could not parse the OSD file”.
segment.target: Check for the following error in the log: ”The Application Virtualization Client could not parse the OSD file”.

segment.source: The Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 client filters out applications that have an OSD file containing an empty OS tag (OS/OS).
segment.target: The Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 client filters out applications that have an OSD file containing an empty OS tag (OS/OS).

segment.source: WORKAROUND Delete the empty OS tag from the OSD file.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Delete the empty OS tag from the OSD file.

segment.source: The App-V server requires exemptions in its firewall for certain processes
segment.target: The App-V server requires exemptions in its firewall for certain processes

segment.source: For the server to stream applications correctly, the server's core processes, including the dispatcher, need access through the firewall.
segment.target: For the server to stream applications correctly, the server's core processes, including the dispatcher, need access through the firewall.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Set exemptions in the server's firewall for the following processes: sghwsvr.exe and sghwdsptr.exe.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Set exemptions in the server's firewall for the following processes: sghwsvr.exe and sghwdsptr.exe.

segment.source: This applies to the App-V Management Server and App-V Streaming Server.
segment.target: This applies to the App-V Management Server and App-V Streaming Server.

segment.source: Sequencing packages that require new Visual Basic runtimes might fail
segment.target: Sequencing packages that require new Visual Basic runtimes might fail

segment.source: If you sequence a package that uses a newer version of a Visual Basic (VB) runtime on a system where an older version of the VB runtime is installed, you might see a crash or other unexpected behavior when you try to use your package.
segment.target: If you sequence a package that uses a newer version of a Visual Basic (VB) runtime on a system where an older version of the VB runtime is installed, you might see a crash or other unexpected behavior when you try to use your package.

segment.source: For example, if you try to sequence Microsoft Money 2007, which uses version 6.00.9782 of the VB runtime, on a Windows XP system with version 6.00.9690 of the VB runtime, you might see a crash in the Invoice Designer when you try to run it on another Windows XP system with that older VB runtime.
segment.target: For example, if you try to sequence Microsoft Money 2007, which uses version 6.00.9782 of the VB runtime, on a Windows XP system with version 6.00.9690 of the VB runtime, you might see a crash in the Invoice Designer when you try to run it on another Windows XP system with that older VB runtime.

segment.source: WORKAROUND After installing the application on the sequencing computer, while still monitoring, copy the correct (newer) VB runtime to the directory in the package from where the executable is started.
segment.target: WORKAROUND After installing the application on the sequencing computer, while still monitoring, copy the correct (newer) VB runtime to the directory in the package from where the executable is started.

segment.source: This allows the sequenced application to find the expected version of the VB runtime when it is started.
segment.target: This allows the sequenced application to find the expected version of the VB runtime when it is started.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This issue has been fixed in Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1.
segment.target: This issue has been fixed in Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1.

segment.source: When the server installer is run in silent mode, it does not correctly check for MSXML6
segment.target: When the server installer is run in silent mode, it does not correctly check for MSXML6

segment.source: The App-V Management Server depends on MSXML6.
segment.target: The App-V Management Server depends on MSXML6.

segment.source: However, if you run the installer in silent mode—for example, by using the command “msiexec -i setup.msi /qn” on a system where MSXML6 is not already installed—the installer does not notice the missing dependency and installs anyway.
segment.target: However, if you run the installer in silent mode—for example, by using the command “msiexec -i setup.msi /qn” on a system where MSXML6 is not already installed—the installer does not notice the missing dependency and installs anyway.

segment.source: The most common result is that when clients attempt to refresh publishing information from the App-V Management Server, they will see failures.
segment.target: The most common result is that when clients attempt to refresh publishing information from the App-V Management Server, they will see failures.

segment.source: WORKAROUND Verify that MSXML6 is installed on the system before attempting a silent install of the App-V Management Server.
segment.target: WORKAROUND Verify that MSXML6 is installed on the system before attempting a silent install of the App-V Management Server.

segment.source: Error code 000C800 when attempting to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console
segment.target: Error code 000C800 when attempting to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console

segment.source: An Application Virtualization administrator who is not a local admin on the Application Virtualization Management Service server will receive an error (Error code: 000C800) when attempting to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console, and the sftmmc.log entry will indicate that access to SftMgmt.udl is denied.
segment.target: An Application Virtualization administrator who is not a local admin on the Application Virtualization Management Service server will receive an error (Error code: 000C800) when attempting to connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console, and the sftmmc.log entry will indicate that access to SftMgmt.udl is denied.

segment.source: To successfully connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console, an Application Virtualization administrator who is not a local admin on the Application Virtualization Management Service server must have at least read and execute access to the SftMgmt.udl file.
segment.target: To successfully connect to the Application Virtualization Management Console, an Application Virtualization administrator who is not a local admin on the Application Virtualization Management Service server must have at least read and execute access to the SftMgmt.udl file.

segment.source: The Application Virtualization administrators must be given read and execute permissions to the SftMgmt.UDL file under %systemdrive%Program FilesMicrosoft System Center App Virt Management ServerApp Virt Management Service.
segment.target: The Application Virtualization administrators must be given read and execute permissions to the SftMgmt.UDL file under %systemdrive%Program FilesMicrosoft System Center App Virt Management ServerApp Virt Management Service.

segment.source: Client installer command-line parameters are ignored when used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1
segment.target: Client installer command-line parameters are ignored when used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1

segment.source: When used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1, the following client installer command-line parameters are ignored: SWICACHESIZE, MINFREESPACEMB, ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING, APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, SYSTEMEVENTLOGLEVEL, SWIGLOBALDATA, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, SWIFSDRIVE, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, SWIUSERDATA, and REQUIRESECURECONNECTION.
segment.target: When used in conjunction with KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1, the following client installer command-line parameters are ignored: SWICACHESIZE, MINFREESPACEMB, ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING, APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, SYSTEMEVENTLOGLEVEL, SWIGLOBALDATA, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, SWIFSDRIVE, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, SWIUSERDATA, and REQUIRESECURECONNECTION.

segment.source: WORKAROUND If you have settings you want to retain, use KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1 and then set the other parameters after deployment.
segment.target: WORKAROUND If you have settings you want to retain, use KEEPCURRENTSETTINGS=1 and then set the other parameters after deployment.

segment.source: The App-V ADM Template can be used to set the following client settings: APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, and ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING.
segment.target: The App-V ADM Template can be used to set the following client settings: APPLICATIONSOURCEROOT, ICONSOURCEROOT, OSDSOURCEROOT, AUTOLOADTARGET, AUTOLOADTRIGGERS, DOTIMEOUTMINUTES, and ALLOWINDEPENDENTFILESTREAMING.

segment.source: The ADM Template can be found at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=121835.
segment.target: The ADM Template can be found at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=121835.

segment.source: Error initializing virtual applications with Symantec Endpoint Protection
segment.target: Error initializing virtual applications with Symantec Endpoint Protection

segment.source: When using Symantec Endpoint Protection with the Application and Device Control feature enabled, virtual applications might fail to start, with the error “The application failed to initialize properly (0xc000007b)”.
segment.target: When using Symantec Endpoint Protection with the Application and Device Control feature enabled, virtual applications might fail to start, with the error “The application failed to initialize properly (0xc000007b)”.

segment.source: For details and workarounds, please refer to the Knowledge Base article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=125851.
segment.target: For details and workarounds, please refer to the Knowledge Base article at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=125851.

segment.source: Important
segment.target: Important

segment.source: This issue has been fixed in Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1.
segment.target: This issue has been fixed in Microsoft Application Virtualization 4.5 Cumulative Update 1.
